title: Simon Cowell's success secrets: How he'll make a star on X Factor: Celebrity
text:
Louis Walsh dishes out the secrets behind Simon Cowell’s success (Picture: ITV)

Louis Walsh will be back on the judging panel for this year’s special series, X Factor: Celebrity.

And it seems he is more than happy to return to the popular show, as he was full of praise for his pal Simon Cowell, and dished out the secrets behind his success.

When chatting about what fans can expect, he gushed over the music mogul and claimed the singing competition is only as great as it is because of Si.

‘It’s simple: Simon Cowell,’ Louis beamed when asked by Closer why the show has so many stars: ‘I know how good he is.’

The 67-year-old continued: ‘He’s a songs man and sees the market. He saw that with Robson and Jerome, with One Direction, Leona Lewis, II Divo, Susan Boyle, Five, Westlife – the list goes on.

He teased a ‘slick’ X Factor: Celebrity (Picture: Syco/Thames TV/PA Wire)

‘He also looks brilliant and as soon as he walks into the room, I start laughing. I don’t know why.’

Teasing what’s to come in the series, the entertainment manager revealed a number of stages have been pulled from the show, making it much more ‘slick’.

‘I think what we’re doing this year is a brilliant idea and everyone is going to love watching these celebrities. The show feels more exciting,’ he explained.

‘There’s no boot camp, no six chair challenge – it feels slick this year. It’s been the best show on TV for a long time and has just had a little rebranding.’

The star wants Sharon back (Picture: WireImage)

He’s excited to be on the judging panel once again (Picture: Getty Images)

Louis will be joining Nicole Scherzinger on the judging panel, but is keen to get Sharon Osbourne back.

He previously told the Mirror: ‘Sharon would be great. She’s burnt a few bridges, but that’s what’s good about her – she has an opinion. She’s never boring or predictable.’

Back in 2018, the Irish star announced his departure from the show following the 14th series.

‘I’ve had a fantastic 13 years on The X Factor but the show needs a change and I’m ready to leave,’ he said at the time.

Meanwhile, Sharon was dropped from the singing contest not soon after she launched into a rant in 2018 where she branded the show ‘f****** karaoke.’
